description: Second Life is a 3D virtual world entirely created by its Residents. Since opening to the public in 2003, it has grown explosively and today is inhabited by millions of members from around the globe. This podcast features: (1) insightful interviews with Linden Lab staff, (2) Video Tutorials by Torley which teach you how to use SL in a fun and fast fashion, and (3) selected machinima works by community creators. You can join us @ secondlife.com
title: Second Life Official: Interviews, Video Tutorials, & Machinima

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #48: Custom collision sounds
episodes.description:
Hey, what’s that sound? The answer here is a little-known fact that needs to be spread more: you can customize the collision sound an object makes. That’s right, you can make a falling anvil sound like its cartoon counterpart, a glass can emit a startling "crash!", or you can do something completely different to confound and astound bystanders. You can even silence an object (like thunky stairs).

NOTE: This feed is being "frozen" for an indefinite amount of time because of low usage. I apologize for the inconvenience. If you want to be notified of new video tutorials, please see http://secondlife.com/video or subscribe directly at http://lindenlab.blip.tv/ or http://www.youtube.com/profile?user=Torley

If you have questions, feel free to contact Torley through his profile's Web tab :)

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #47: How to report abuse
episodes.description: The Governance Team and Torley present an awesome video tutorial which shows you how to file effective abuse reports and deal with griefer problems in Second Life!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #46: Make a glowing neon sign
episodes.description: ArtRage, the natural-media painting program, is so easy to use with Second Life. Not only does it have a free version, with use of transparencies (download it @ http://torley.s3.amazonaws.com/transparent-canvases-for-ArtRage.zip ) , you can make glowing graffiti that suspends in the air and dazzles those who gaze upon it!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #45: Change the default texture
episodes.description: Every time you click the Default button in the texture picker, it shows you the yellowy plywood which has served us for years. But what if you want to choose your own Default texture? Watch this and find out how!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #44: A tour of Torley's island!
episodes.description: There's a region named Here in Second Life, and it's Torley Linden's creative land o' chaos. You can video tutorials inworld, try some of the kewl stuff Torley raves about in-context, and get excited about creative possibilities. After all, the best way to understand Second Life is to experience it.

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #43: What's new in Second Life 1.20!
episodes.description: After a second lifetime of testing, it's out in the wild as the main viewer! What features await you, and how can you benefit from them? Watch this, and in less than 8 minutes, you'll know!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Voice Chat: Customize Speech Gestures
episodes.description: Harmony Linden got me thinking: I haven’t yet seen a custom speech gesture pack. Has anyone made one? In the meantime, watch this to get started. Do backflips and belly laughs while you enunciate, for all I care.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Voice Chat: Turn on Lip Sync
episodes.description: Make your avatar’s lips move while talking. One of the coolest "hidden" features we have; you’ll need at least version 1.20 (not the existing 1.19 viewer) to play with this. Don’t forget to check out the documentation!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Camera Options sliders in action
episodes.description: What do they do? I'll show you!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Boost performance with Graphics Preferences
episodes.description: With a few clicks, you can make Second Life run faster/smoother. Especially recommended if you’re new to SL and having a tough time.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Increase graphics detail beyond Preferences
episodes.description: On a powerful enough computer? Want to take extra-high-quality snapshots? Maybe you need to do this!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Change the viewer's skin
episodes.description: New in Second Life 1.20 is the easy option to choose how the user interface looks. Don’t forget, more customizability is on the way!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Explore with Profile Picks surfing
episodes.description: I’m crazy about sharing better ways to get around. Here’s an unobvious-but-valuable way to "connect the dots".

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: What are coalesced objects?
episodes.description: They’re what happens when you take more than one object at the same time. See this to understand why they’re both a pleasure and a pain.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Linden trees in coalesced objects
episodes.description: Got Linden trees in a coalesced/combined object you can’t rez because you don’t have land? Courtesy of our Support Team comes a workaround.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Sitting
episodes.description: You need to know this. But even if you do, did you know these tricks? See inside!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Make stuff easier to sit on
episodes.description: You should also know this. The sit click action lets people sit on your creations (both scripted and not) with one left-click! There’s hardly ever reason to not use it on chairs, poseballs, and so on.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Restore your lost Local Chat tab
episodes.description: If you forgot where it went, don’t panic. Just watch this and you’ll be on your way.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: See who's looking at you with Show Look At
episodes.description: By popular request! Know if you’re being watched. Thanx to Richard Linden for info on what the different colors mean.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: See where you're pointing with Show Point At
episodes.description: A related feature to Show Look At. Hopefully per VWR-8144 on the Issue Tracker, it’ll be easier to use.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Show invisible objects with Highlight Transparent
episodes.description: Ever run into a wall you couldn’t see? Here’s how to reveal them. Other uses of invisible objects also covered.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: View webpages with the Media Browser
episodes.description: Ever wanted to easily pop open an in-viewer web browser? Here’s how!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: What is that white dot over my head?
episodes.description: It's your voice chat status indicator. Here's how to turn it off.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: What is the Library?
episodes.description: In your Inventory window is a folder with Linden-provided stock content, including avatars, textures, etc.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Bookmark Second Life places in your web browser I
episodes.description: You can use the familiar comfort of Firefox or another browser to store inworld landmarks.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Bookmark Second Life places in your web browser II
episodes.description: Here's more info on SLURLs and how to control where you teleport. By understanding this better, you’ll be closer to mastering inworld exploration as I have.

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #42: Get started scripting with Autoscript
episodes.description: Second Life scripting is a lot easier with Autoscript, Ann Enigma's simple tool to generate scripts for popular purposes: giving notecards, changing an object's color, and playing sounds are all possible. Enhance your inworld interactions and watch this video tutorial to learn how!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #41: Make an awesome shirt with ArtRage
episodes.description: In Second Life, you never have to fear losing your shirt, because you can always make a new one in a just a few minutes! Follow along with Torley as he paints the way forward.

episodes.title: Across the Metaverse: from Second Life to OpenSim
episodes.description: Researchers from IBM and Linden Lab® gathered in an experimental area of the 3D virtual world, Second Life. Together they prepared to teleport outside Second Life to another virtual world, called OpenSim. It was a journey no avatar had taken before. More info @ http://blog.secondlife.com/2008/07/08/ibm-linden-lab-interoperability-announcement/

episodes.title: SL5B: Mitch Kapor's Closing Keynote (VIDEO)
episodes.description: Mitch Kapor, on Linden Lab's Board of Directors, and Robin Harper, VP of Marketing & Community Development, wrap up the Second Life 5th's Birthday festivities with a keynote address. You can find more info @ https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/SL5B

episodes.title: SL5B: Mitch Kapor's Closing Keynote (AUDIO-only)
episodes.description: Mitch Kapor, on Linden Lab's Board of Directors, and Robin Harper, VP of Marketing & Community Development, wrap up the Second Life 5th's Birthday festivities with a keynote address. You can find more info @ https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/SL5B

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #40: Make seamless textures with Wood Workshop
episodes.description: Torley shows you how easy it can be to make great, realistic (or surrealistic) textures which seamlessly tile (no ugly gaps between repeats) in a matter of minutes. Discover, experiment, and enjoying Wood Workshop with Second Life!

episodes.title: SL5B: Philip & M's Opening Keynote (AUDIO-only)
episodes.description: Chairman of the Board Philip and CEO M Linden of Linden Lab kick off the celebration of Second Life 5th's Birthday with a keynote address. You can find more info @ https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/SL5B

episodes.title: SL5B: Philip & M's Opening Keynote (VIDEO)
episodes.description: Chairman of the Board Philip and CEO M Linden of Linden Lab kick off the celebration of Second Life 5th's Birthday with a keynote address. You can find more info @ https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/SL5B

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #39: Record voice chat and sounds
episodes.description: Torley walks you through recording voice chat (and other sounds) in Second Life. Whether you want to capture a public event (like a meeting or class) or do a podcast, these fundamentals will get you on the right track.

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #38: What is a group liability?
episodes.description: This video tutorial explains what "group liabilities" are and why it's important to check your groups to see if you're being charged small amounts of L$ each week for listing group-owned parcels in Search. Wow, what a mouthful of a sentence. It's easier if I show you -- watch the video!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #37: Who are Lindens?
episodes.description: Learn more about Linden Lab employees! In this funtastical video tour, I'll show you: you how to meet Lindens in-avatar via Office Hours, where to find out more about specific employee expertise, how to tell if a Linden is genuine (impersonation is not only stupid, it's against our Terms of Service). And... are you familiar with collectible Linden bears?

episodes.title: Inside the Lab #4: Education discussion
episodes.description:
Katt Linden interviews Pathfinder and Claudia Linden about some of the fascinating education projects taking place in Second Life. These two expert Lindens share some of what they’ve learned working with educators inworld and at conferences, as well as from participation with some of the groups described in the podcast.

See this for the full details and text transcript:

     » http://blog.secondlife.com/2008/06/02/inside-the-lab-podcast-a-discussion-on-education-in-second-life/

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #36: Let friends & groups edit your objects
episodes.description:
Sharing is caring! (Or something like that.) And a big benefit of Second Life is being able to collaborate with friends & groups of people you share interests with -- live, in realtime.

Ever wanted someone to help you reposition furniture? Or perhaps remodel your house? That's what friends are for. What about giving other group members the ability to change your objects so you can build together and (hopefully) make magnificent stuff?

But remember, with great power comes great responsibility (like Uncle Ben said), so only give your permissions to those you trust.

Here's what's inside:

00:28 - Share objects with a group 
02:22 - What does "Deed" mean?
02:39 - Intro to group Roles & Abilities
04:24 - Let friends edit your objects
07:52 - Allow anyone to move and copy your objects

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: 3 ways to get to About Land
episodes.description: Did you know viewing parcel info can be done via no less than a trio of paths?

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Avatar Rendering Cost
episodes.description: ARC is a useful tool which shows you how much viewer-side lag other avatars incur. For full details, see: http://blog.secondlife.com/2008/05/01/who-me-yes-you-couldnt-be-then-who-introducing-avatar-rendering-cost/

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Find Friends & Groups faster
episodes.description: Type in the first few letters of a friend or group to select them in the list.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Give stuff to someone nearby
episodes.description: Here's how to transfer inventory to another Resident whose avatar is close to yours.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Give stuff to someone remote
episodes.description: Here's how to transfer inventory to another Resident who's far away (you can't see them in-avatar).

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Instant viewer download link
episodes.description: http://get.secondlife.com will instantly download the newest main viewer in the current operating system you're on.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Learn the Lag Meter
episodes.description: Saying "lag" by itself is like saying "I hurt" to a doctor. But where, and what kind of pain? Have a look at the lag meter!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Make a 1-way tinted window
episodes.description: This simple exercise can be applied whenever you want to texture faces of a prim independently and differently.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Open the Advanced menu
episodes.description: Within this hidden menu are many powerful features which I've covered in other tutorials. Since they're unsupported, use them at your own risk... be aware!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Scroll through tabs faster
episodes.description: Just click and drag the mouse button to blaze through!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Stop falling through floors
episodes.description: Have adjacent parcels of land which span more than one region? You'll want to check out this workaround.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Troubleshoot sound not playing
episodes.description: A quick run-through of reasons why you might not be hearing sound. Be sure your speakers are on, too.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Turn off annoying UI sounds
episodes.description: Want to silence the IM "ding-ding!" or any other user interface sound selectively? We have an Advanced menu option for that.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Unwear attachments to give them
episodes.description: Unintuitive but it works: you can give body parts/clothes while wearing, yet attachments (objects) need to be taken off first

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Use the pie menu quicker
episodes.description: By holding down the right mouse button and releasing it on a pie menu "slice", you can use options with less effort.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: What do parcel status icons mean?
episodes.description: Hover over to get a tooltip, or click to get an extended description.

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #35: Watch YouTube videos in Second Life
episodes.description: Did you know many (but not all) YouTube videos can be played in Second Life? Torley's here to show you! Learn how to use a link-maker tool to get a QuickTime-compatible link that you can watch on your parcel inworld. We'll also cover making a basic movie screen. Lots of fun to be had, so don't miss out!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #34: Learn building at the Ivory Tower of Primitives
episodes.description: Torley gives you a guided tour of one of the most venerable and valuable resources in Second Life, the Ivory Tower (Library) of Primitives in Natoma. Learn how to build at your own pace as you ascend the floors and stare in amazement at what is possible!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #33: Play parcel music
episodes.description: I show you how to play parcel music in Second Life -- including Internet radio stations -- in less than 10 minutes! Yes, it's really that simple, and along the way, I highlight good things to know.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Add a webpage to your profile
episodes.description: Do this to add extra info or a splash of fun to your existing profile, which is useful for showing others who you are.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Change text and effect colors
episodes.description: Want to change the hue of those dots that come out of your hand when you select stuff? Here’s the ticket, and you can customize chat text tones too!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Click actions make using stuff easier
episodes.description: CLICK ACTIONS ROCK. If you’re not using them, YOU MUST. Why am I TYPING IN ALL CAPS? Watch and find out!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Get high in the sky instantly
episodes.description: Sitting on a cube and repositioning it is a practical, more controlled alternative to flying manually.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Make flexible objects
episodes.description: Once a glorious new feature, now the basis of hair, skirts, and more wonderful creations! Learn how to make flexiprims from scratch.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Make local light objects
episodes.description: Lights can -- well, light up a scene! But remember, there can only be 6 lights onscreen at once! I explain why this is, and wear your facelights wisely.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Open a box
episodes.description: A basic skill everyone needs to know! Once you buy something, you often have to unpack it. It’s straightforward once you know how, and here’s how.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Prim and mesh hair differences
episodes.description: Another goodie for newcomers: do you know how to tell which is which and why it matters? Watch and see!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Rebake textures to fix clothing glitches
episodes.description: One of my favorite unfavorite workarounds. Someday, improved texture compositing will (I hope) remedy these glitches, but until then, here’s a tip that’s been passed on and on.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Redock tabs to clear clutter
episodes.description: A simple click helps you clean your screen of stray windows.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Save textures to disk
episodes.description: I used to get asked this question a lot: whether you want to back up some textures or edit them for reuploading, I show you what you should know.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Save your avatar's outfit
episodes.description: I’m famed for my wide variety of avatars! How do I do it? Each one is an “outfit” within a folder which can be switched in seconds. Stay organized and express yourself!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Sell Original, Copy, or Contents?
episodes.description: If you sell stuff, you MUST know the difference between these. Choosing “Contents” removes the extra steps for unpacking boxes (see above). Make things easy for your customers and they’ll love ya!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Show who's chatting around you
episodes.description: Another button that isn’t so obvious: click the "< <" in Local Chat or a group IM, and presto, a list of speakers. Good if you find camera controls awkward to gawk at nametags.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Skip popups after reinstalling
episodes.description: Popups -- when you don’t wanna see ‘em -- are annoying! Dismiss them with a single click and continue forth. Conversely, you can show all of them again, in case you missed any before.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Sort columns for easier selection
episodes.description: Tired of voice chatters in Active Participants shuffling around faster than you can click? You can click columns in this window, and others too!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Take a snapshot
episodes.description: Second Life photography is thriving. It all begins by pressing down a special key, which doesn’t play a melody… but will save a snapshot to disk! Also see my AWESOME GUIDE TO HIGH-QUALITY PHOTOGRAPHY ( https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/Snapshot_Help ) --with, you guessed it, video tutorials!

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Texture shortcuts
episodes.description: After you’ve applied 1000s of textures as I have, you’ll be keen to expedite the process.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: The 1-prim barstool trick
episodes.description: Primfficiency, building wisely by economizing # of prims while maximizing visual results, has evolved greatly (to sculpties @ http://blog.secondlife.com/2008/05/04/sculpted-prims-made-simple-video-tip-of-the-week-32/ !). The 1-prim barstool trick is fun if you’ve never built before. Torley-bot guides you.

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Use Inventory filters
episodes.description: Filters help you narrow down searches and temporarily hide clutter. They’re also (sadly) a cause of perceived (not actual) inventory loss, so make sure to reset them as I demonstrate!

episodes.title: Tip of the Week #32: Sculpted prims made simple
episodes.description:
Friendly greetings! You can learn Second Life in a fun and fast fashion! The enthusiastic Torley is your host, taking you on a tour through tips, tricks, and techniques that'll increase your confidence and make you smile. :) Whether you're a newcomer or longtime Resident, your inworld experience will benefit from these video tutorials.

More info @ torley.com/vidtuts

"VIRTUAL KNOWLEDGE, REAL RESULTS."

episodes.title: QUICKTIP: Copy Selection

episodes.title: Second Life: Get One
episodes.description:
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike -  2006 Movie Trailer Contest Winner
Second Life is a 3-D virtual world entirely built and owned by its residents. Since opening to the public in 2003, it has grown explosively and today is inhabited by over 700,000 people from around the globe.

episodes.title: Suzanne's Guitar
episodes.description: In August 2006, Suzanne Vega will become the first major recording artist to perform live in Second Life avatar form.  This forms part of a larger project sponsored by The Infinite Mind, a public radio show which has hired Infinite Vision Media to create a permanent presence in Second Life.  Robbie Dingo was commissioned by Boliver Oddfellow (CEO, Infinite Visions) to make the Guitar and animation for the Vega avatar (created by Munchflower Zaius). The following is a fantastic short video that shows Robbie's considerable building skills at work while he whips into shape a lifelike replica of Suzanne Vega's guitar for the event.

episodes.title: Better Life
episodes.description:
Having first identified the music I wanted to use and decided upon the general story line, I created the props and story-boarded the whole film using a series of in-world snapshots.
			This allowed me to get a view of the pace, continuity and balance of the film before committing to any filming.
			I was surprised by how much this felt like making a real world film, moving the actor and 'camera man' (my alternative avatar) into position, checking the lighting and at times having to wait for things not directly under my control to be right, like the clouds for example.
			SecondLife is a great platform and backdrop for this type of movie...you need a prop or special effect - so you make it.

episodes.title: Town Hall: April 6, 2006
episodes.description: Philip Rosedale talks about current development focus and takes questions from Second Life residents for the first Town Hall podcast with audio.

episodes.title: Silver Bells & Golden Spurs
episodes.description:
Silver Bells and Golden Spurs is the story of a showdown between two bad guys, captured in the real-time virtual world of Second Life. 
			A gunslinger comes into town looking for a local bad guy, and finds him in a local saloon. 
			The two men exchange threats and bet on who's the quicker draw. For the outcome, you must watch the movie! 
			The assets for this movie were made in real-time, involving SL users from Canada, Scotland, United States, and Australia. 
			Every character is a real actor somewhere in the world, and the movie was made the same way motion pictures are - from script to print. 
			It's an adventure in a new medium for movie making.
